trans-unit.source: Provides helper functions for exposing events and data for management.
There is a single instance of this class per application domain.
Note: the WMI .NET libraries are now considered in final state, and no further development, enhancements, or updates will be available for non-security related issues affecting these libraries.
The [MI APIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj152383%28v=vs.80%29.aspx) should be used for all new development.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.Instrumentation.Instrumentation"></xref> class.
The default constructor initializes any fields to their default values.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Raises a management event.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The object that determines the class, properties, and values of the event.
Determines if the instrumentation schema of the specified assembly has already been correctly registered with WMI.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The <xref href="System.Reflection.Assembly"></xref> containing instrumentation instance or event types.
`true` if the instrumentation schema in the specified assembly is registered with WMI; otherwise, `false`.
Makes an instance visible through management instrumentation.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The object that is to be visible through management instrumentation.
Registers the management instance or event classes in the specified assembly with WMI.
This ensures that the instrumentation schema is accessible to <xref href="System.Management"></xref> client applications.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The <xref href="System.Reflection.Assembly"></xref> containing instrumentation instance or event types.

Makes an instance that was previously published through the <xref href="System.Management.Instrumentation.Instrumentation.Publish(System.Object)"></xref> method no longer visible through management instrumentation.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The object to remove from visibility for management instrumentation.
Specifies the maximum number of objects of the specified type to be provided at a time.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The class for which the batch size is being set.
The maximum number of objects to be provided at a time.
